Reviews.Title: Good, but not great
Reviews.Author: Jim Larsen
Reviews.Content: This is a good small point and shoot camera for the price.  It is easy to use, has a very clear menu, and a very large LCD display.  If you are looking for a 5X zoom with simple menus and an extra big display, this is a great deal.  The downside with this camera is that the picture quality is not as good as more expensive cameras, and it does not do well in low light situations.  The flash has an effective range of 9.8 feet.  Beyond that range the picture will have poor focus or lots of digital noise.  It says it can do 1600 and 3200 ISO, but the quality goes down in those situations.  The manual says that even in 10 MB Fine mode (highest resolution) they don't recommend enlarging beyond 8 x 12 prints (which was the limitation of my last 3MP Olympus camera).  It is nice and compact and easy to use.  You will be happy with it as a snapshot camera, but you will want to spend more if you are a serious photographer.  I have rated this a 5 because I think you get what you pay for.  Even with its limitations, it is a great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Small camera - big punch
Reviews.Author: Toothless "OldMan"
Reviews.Content: This is a great point and shoot camera.  Small enough to fit comfortably in a shirt pocket and capable enough to capture the fleeting moments of life and preserve them forever more.  Wide angle makes pictures of groups much easier to take.  Picture quality is great and with ten mega pixels a picture can be cropped to capture only the desired elements and still look good. Battery life is very long, but when it is about done it depletes quickly.  Best option would be to have an extra charged battery with you.One improvement that could be made is to the internal flash.  It works for pictures of ten feet or under, but the light falls off quickly after ten feet.  But this is a point and shoot camera and if you need to take flash pictures at greater distance, get a studio digital camera with a separate flash attachment.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!!!
Reviews.Author: A. Garcia
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!!!!!! it's very intuitive, easy to use, great quality, beautiful colors and many options.Not for manual mode, it doesn't have many options for manual.

Reviews.Title: Terrible pictures and LCD unusable in sunlight
Reviews.Author: Sam Beckett
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were originally going to buy a Canon SD1200, but the Fuji was $30 cheaper and I wanted to try something different after my old 4mp Canon, which took very good pictures but had been damaged. Within a few days of buying the Fuji I regretted it.The flash creates very washed out indoor pictures. I was shocked when I saw the first shots of our baby- my old Canon had much better colour definition with flash. Even non-flash pictures didn't have the quality I was used to, parts of the image were lacking definition, certainly not printworthy. In addition, the lack of a viewfinder means you are totally reliant on the LCD display to take pictures, which is useless on a sunny day- the screen just looks black, you can't actually see what you're trying to shoot. We ended up taking pictures of garbage cans and bushes instead of our son!We returned the camera in favour of the Canon we originally intended to buy.

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD CAMERA
Reviews.Author: R. Greene "SlowHand"
Reviews.Content: Have had this camera for a month and find it to be a very good camera. The pictures are very good.I would recommend this camera with the only caveat that it is difficult to see the screen in full daylight.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm J150W
Reviews.Author: D. N. STEEN
Reviews.Content: This is the third J150 I've purchased, 1 for myself & my 2 sons. It does not dissapoint! The camera features are amazing and it takes great photos. I was amazed at the battery life and the big screen! Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: I paid $30 more...still worth it!
Reviews.Author: RocketJay
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this camera. Easy to use,good results and I paid $30.00 more for it just a few weeks ago. Still worth it at that price.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for a great little price
Reviews.Author: E. Campbell "Lady of Astolat"
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by the ease of use. Especially pleased with the photos it's produced.  Nothing complicated about it, enough options to please everyone.I'm grateful for the rechargeable battery and the battery charger that are both included.No regrets on this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Inconsistent Pictures
Reviews.Author: A. Reeves
Reviews.Content: I didn't like this camera and sent it back.  The pictures were very inconsistent - I took two pictures of the exact same thing at the exact same time and they each turned out different - with different lighting and coloring.  Also, sometimes the flash was so bright it whited out the subject's face and you could hardly see them.

Reviews.Title: Really good starter camera
Reviews.Author: S.Amicucci
Reviews.Content: So a few years ago i really wanted a camera because i did not have one. I like to do a lot of research about what im looking for before i buy it. So i found this camera and it works really well. The pictures are amazing and the zoom is real nice. Its slim and slides right into your pocket. I have a case for mine because i did not want it to get messed up because it looks so nice. Once i took some photos with it, one of my friends had a old Nikon D200 laying around and gave it to me to use. She really liked the quality of what this small camera showed and thought it was time to step up. So over all if you want a really good point and shoot camera without breaking the bank, then i think you should get this camera. I will even post some photos that i took with it to show how good it is. Some of the photos i changed the color around.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: tth29
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a gift because I own one myself and love it.  It takes great pictures and is very reasonably priced.  My only complaint about this camera is the lag time of the shot.  Sometimes the subject has moved on before the flash/shutter snaps ruining the shot.  Of course, this is a point and shoot not a digital SLR so that is expected across all brands, not just this one.  For the price it's a minor, although sometimes aggravating minus.  Overall I love it and think it is well worth the price for picture quality and portability.  Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the price
Reviews.Author: David Hollander
Reviews.Content: This camera takes pictures that are very crisp looking until enlarged beyond a standard 8.5" x 11" paper size.  It has a generous amount of functionality although I would have liked the option of changing the shutter speed in the manual shooting mode.  Overall I am very pleased with this point-n-shoot, especially for the price.  The cons listed above were not a deal breaker for me when researching this camera and I would still purchase this camera if I had to do over it again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Seattle-ite
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use and has a nice big screen with an easy to read menu.  It is slim and fits easily into a small bag or purse.  The zoom is good and it takes very clear photos!  Love it!  Oh yeah, and the video works great too!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!!
Reviews.Author: Silly Nilly
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, large lcd screen, colors are incredible, many different shooting options to get that perfect picture.  Takes great photos!

Reviews.Title: Sweet
Reviews.Author: T. Grove
Reviews.Content: It rocks.  Nice clarity. Good screen.  Love the size. Easy to use.  Can't beat the price in it's class.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures but does have a downside...
Reviews.Author: Clyde J. Corbin "CJ"
Reviews.Content: This is a fine camera and takes GREAT pictures. The camera is awesome for the casual user. The only downside is the fact that the camera is EXTREMELY delicate. The wrist strap broke and the camera fell about 2ft and has not been working well since. I love the camera and it is at Fuji being fixed...thank God for the warranty. The only reccomendation I have for the Fuji guys is to make the camera more durable.

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera
Reviews.Author: Warren Miller "rapidmiller"
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best camera buys that I have ever made.  I have purchased an Olympus, Kodak, HP, and another Fujifilm camera.  This camera has more bang for the buck than any other camera.  It's clarity is fantastic at 10 MP, the zoom lens is easy and clear, and most important it has a larger screen on the back than any camera we have previously owned.  It's size is thinner than other cameras and about the same other dimensions.  I'm very please with where I bought it, the price and quality.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm camera
Reviews.Author: Southern Gal
Reviews.Content: Fujifilm FinePix J150W 10MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom (Black)This camera was a gift.  The recipient had been extremely pleased with this camera.  It is small enough to fit in a pocket but the pictures are very good.

Reviews.Title: Fulifilm Pine Pix J150
Reviews.Author: E. Gattsek "Tpted"
Reviews.Content: Product was easy to use and a good size, but the images it took were really sub-par.  I own a old Canon and was happy with it, I just wanted a more modern camera.  Fujifilm wasnt the right one for me.I got another Canon after all.

Reviews.Title: good camera, poor seller
Reviews.Author: L. Hancock "tj4037"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera on Nov 24th from Amazon.com as a Christmas present to be sent to my son in Montana. Because of the range of delivery days the seller gave for delivery, I had to wait until Dec 17th to find out that he didn't send the camera. USPS tracking showed he had sent electronic notification that he intended to send a camera, but they hadn't received it. zcv1 (Leon) said he would check with USPS to find the camera, then after a couple days waiting, he said he had "another of the same cameras in silver that he would expedite to my son". My son finally received the camera on Christmas eve. I'm not sure what his angle was, or if he had just run out of cameras, but it was a bunch of bulls---. My son liked the camera he received though.

ProductInfo.Features:
10-megapixel sensor captures enough detail for photo-quality 18 x 24-inch prints
5x optical zoom; wide-angle (28mm) lens
3-inch LCD screen; Micro Thumbnail view
Face Detection and Red-eye removal
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Fujifilm FinePix J150W 10MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom (Black)
